result.execSummary:
The defendant James S Meyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation by 4:00 p.m. on 7/11/2017.
Must follow rules of supervision.
May petition for early discharge after 1/2 time served.
Concurrent with: 15CF452

miscConds.notes: $250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office.  Bond from 16CF110 to be applied.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.  
If not a U.S. Citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Must provide a DNA sample.
$75.00 Restitution paid directly to victim.  10% surcharge waived. (As a read-in from 16CF110)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James S Meyer

Ct 2 - DRI

SENTENCE:  w/h sent, 18 mo prob- concurrent w/one another, DNA sample & $250.00 surcharge on each, court costs waive, Bond in 16CF110 to be applied.  Follow rules of supervision, may petition for early discharge after 1/2 time served.  $75.00 Restitution - paid directly to victim today.  Waive 10% surcharge.  Must report to probation by 4:00 on 7/11/17.  Not eligible for SAP or CIP.  May not possess or use firearms or body armor.  May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.  If not a U.S. Citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. PCR 4:38 pm adj.
